Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and PIRATE already has more than that, KMD is almost there

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: And what limits you from making Z-nSPV clients?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the ability to sign the ztransaction locally

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
Okay, I'll try to explore Zcash's Lightwalletd project which is working on making a Z Lite clients.
https://github.com/zcash-hackworks/lightwalletd

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I know @radix42 already explored it, and had some issue trying with KMD. I'll have a look and see what I can understand out of it. Hope that will help.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, not sure if that is an SPV client or API wallet, i think more the latter

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: true....

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: anyway looking forward to your nSPV code! üòÉ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is easy enough, i dont plan to code it myself

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @jl777c another question. Right now AtomicDEX uses Electrum based SPV clients in backend. I guess we can also upgrade it to use nSPV when it's available after enough testing and stabilisation? What you think how much of work that will be?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: my understanding is that the wallet functions are cleanly separated in atomicDEX, so once there is an SPV wallet, it is a matter to use it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think blackjok3r, dimxy, mihailo are all able to do the required daemon side code and can more fully describe to whoever wants to implement the daemon side. shouldnt be more than a week or two of work. the main work is the nSPV client to become a valid peer on the p2p network. the actual message processing wont be that much work once it is a valid peer

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
very good!
CC: @blackjok3r @dukeleto @dimxy @Mihailo @radix42 @miketout @artem.pikulin @ca333  ü§û

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: certainly all the devs on that CC list are able to, but likely most are very saturated

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and likely nSPV is so simple, none of them would need much help from me

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: agree, just hoping for the best! üòÉ

Author: willofleo#7505
Content: does this feature a solve to the hack problem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not that specific hack, which was essentially a keylogger

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but having nearly native level security and api wallet performance that is fully decentralized and scalable...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is quite a nice improvement across the board

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it also allows mm2 to scale to millions of users

Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: how many nodes would be necessary for mm2 to scale to that level?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it uses the p2p network of the coin

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at the 1000 node level, i estimate a million users can be supported

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: roughly speaking

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and currently KMD has about that and PIRATE has more than that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it would still work with less nodes, just slower

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: hi there,

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content: I realize KMD isn't really supposed to use kvupdate/kvsearch, but out of curiousity I'm testing it out a little bit on the KMD chain (mostly my own testnet until now, for demonstration only)

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content:
```./komodo-cli kvupdate foo "bar" 2 "examplepassphrase"
{
  "coin": "KMD",
  "height": 1424321,
  "expiration": 1425761,
  "flags": 3,
  "key": "foo",
  "keylen": 3,
  "value": "bar",
  "valuesize": 3,
  "fee": 0.001,
  "txid": "1f50efcbfe816358992e531f86287e2d03d628bb72a6488344887cf8385cc880"
```

Content: https://kmdexplorer.io/tx/1f50efcbfe816358992e531f86287e2d03d628bb72a6488344887cf8385cc880

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content:
```./komodo-cli kvsearch foo                            
{
  "coin": "KMD",
  "currentheight": 1424324,
  "key": "foo",
  "keylen": 3,
  "error": "cant find key"
```

Author: smellycouch#3071
Content:
Done through a temporary revert of this commit: 
 <https://github.com/jl777/komodo/commit/3e71f5857f508ff15e31259562f72831b43e26de#diff-af3b225f99be8159f2ebab310948c711>

Content: Of course I understand it's not actually supposed to function, but, I'm just curious why it doesn't when that commit is reverted?  As we know it works great for asset chains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure, probably a few other places need to be reenabled

Content: it has been years since i worked on that code, so i forget details

Content: ok thanks.   When I figure it out I'll post for record üòÉ

found it.  For future reference:

Content: it gives even more powers to masternodes. the more powers special nodes have, the closer it goes to centralization. do we know that the majority of MN are not controlled by a single entity?

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: @jl777c nSPV... Following most of what was said so far... All dPoW notarized coins are thus far supposed to have 100% confidence in spends after a single notarization... So would the same not hold true for lite wallet transactions... Would the change to make nSPV real just be trimming the lite wallet to load only the last notarized blocking and be fully confident in spends?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: lite wallet is using electrum server, nSPV uses the coins p2p network

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: #dev-nspv has all the details

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: Ty

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: Hi JL, what do you think about the coordicide solution from IOTA. If they manage to make that work, wouldnt that be the ideal decentralized and scalable DLT? Is KMD locked in on dPow or is KMD able to change the mechanism if a better solution comes around (can be coordicide or something else)?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: coordicide is a mechanism to remove the centralization of the tangle coordinator

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD doesnt have a tangle, nor a centralized coordinator to remove

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you cant just throw buzzwords around and expect the code would magically change around. abandoning blockchain and adopting a DAG... that is not practical
